refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: The ltsconvert tool converts the labelled transition system (LTS) in &infile; to &outfile; in the requested format after applying the selected minimisation method to &infile; (default is no minimisation). If &outfile; is not supplied, &stdout; is used. If &infile; is not supplied, &stdin; is used.

The output format is determined by the extension of &outfile;, whereas the input format is determined by the content of &infile;. Options &opt_in; and &opt_out; can be used to force the input and output formats. A list of supported formats can be requested by using the option &opt_formats;.

In order to convert a non-mCRL2 LTS to a mCRL2 LTS one needs to supply the original LPE with &opt_lpe;. This is because actions need to be stored in the internal mCRL2 format in mCRL2 and in non-mCRL2 LTSs are represented by strings (lacking essential information such as data types).

Note that tools that use the &fsm; format may depend on state information and parameter names. The former requires that the state information is in the input LTS file and the latter that the &opt_lpe; option is used (see the options sections below).
